long_desc.thetext:
Extraneous line breaks appear in Internet Explorer 9 when setting content programmatically via setValue() or via the constructor.
For examples see:
The value is set via constructor call: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/devel/demobrowser/#widget~HtmlArea.html
The value is set via setValue(): http://www.phonetizer.com
Enter some English text into the left side pane and hit Transcribe. You will get the resulting text back in the right pane that uses htmlarea for output.
Phonetizer.com is my web app where I use htmlarea and see the problem.
Thanks for the report. Alex, could you please check how critical that is and schedule it for the release if you think you can get it done?
It's pretty critical for me. I think it should be fixed in the next bug-fix release. I don't think I can fix it myself though. I'm pretty new to both qooxdoo and JavaScript.

(In reply to comment #2) > It's pretty critical for me. I think it should be fixed in the next bug-fix > release.
As every other bug reporter. ;) But please keep in mind that we have to take care of more than one bug and we will check if there is something more critical to do.

@Alexei Please provide us some more information to get this one fixed.
The content what is used together with the "setValue" method is important here. So please drop a line what content is set here.
Discontinued support for htmlarea in the framework, set all open issues to WONTFIX. Still available as a contribution acc. to bug #7918 .
